result.execSummary:
The defendant Isaiah Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court
Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay a fine of $700.00 including all costs. Court ordered fine and surcharges to be paid at the rate of $100.00 per month commencing 03-01-16 or, as a penalty if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Isaiah Johnson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: See CCAP financial payment plan application for specific monthly due dates for this UTPPP.

Defendant Isaiah Johnson in court with attorney Ann M Heaps.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 4 DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for 4 days served FOR A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court ordered the defendant to submit a DNA sample and pay the surcharge.  Court ordered defendant to pay a FINE of $700.00 INCLUDING ALL COSTS. Court ordered the fine and surcharges to be paid at the rate of $100.00 per month commencing March 1, 2016 or, as a penalty if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Isaiah Johnson in court with attorney Ann M Heaps.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Case calendared for motion hearing.  Defense withdraws motion and requests a final pretrial and jury trial date in Branch 24.  The State will leave its' offer open until the final pretrial date.  Parties are advised that effective December 14, 2015, this case will be assigned to the Reserve Judge presiding in Branch 21 in room 622 of the Courthouse.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Filed:
*  State's Response to Defense Motion to Suppres.
*  State's Response to Defendant's Brief in Support of Motion to Dismiss the Complaint.
*  State's Reponse to Defendant's Brief in Support of Challenging the Constitutionality of Statute.

Defendant Isaiah Johnson in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court finds that defense motion was filed untimely and the State did not file a response.  The State's witnesses were called off in error.  Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 24.  Court ordered the State to file a response by September 17, 2015.  Motion hearing scheduled for November 25, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Filed:
*  Defendant's Brief in Support of Challenging the Constitutionality of Statute.
*  Defendant's Brief in Support of Motion to Dismiss the Complaint.

Defendant Isaiah Johnson in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.  Defense counsel's brief due June 8, 2015, State's response by July 8, 2015.    Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 24.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 10:00 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Isaiah Johnson in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Defendant Isaiah Johnson in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
